alert.note: Alert for Northwest Yell County; Southern Johnson County; Southern Pope County; Southern and Eastern Logan County; Western and Northern Logan County; Yell Excluding Northwest (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 7:22PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Logan, south central Johnson, northeastern Yell and southwestern Pope Counties through 745 PM CDT... At 721 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Danville, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Russellville... Dardanelle... Ola... London... Lake Dardanelle State Park... Lake Dardanelle... Petit Jean River WMA... Mt Nebo State Park... Mosley... Lakeview in Yell County... Ranger... Holla Bend... Mt George... Delaware... Chickalah... Centerville... New Blaine... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for central and western Arkansas.
